title: Authors and Citation
text: Carl Beuchel. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Beuchel C (2026). ofhelper: Working DNAnexus's Future Health Trusted Research Environment. R package version 0.3.0, https://comp-med.github.io/r-ofhelper/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ofhelper: Working with and on DNAnexus's Our Future Health Trusted Research Environment},   author = {Carl Beuchel},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.3.0},   url = {https://comp-med.github.io/r-ofhelper/}, }

what: Working with and on DNAnexus's Our Future Health Trusted Research Environment
title: Working with and on DNAnexus's Our Future Health Trusted Research Environment
text: collection helper functions utilities make working DNAnexus-based Future Health TRE convenient. provides wrapper functions around dx utility therefore exclusively useful working specific TRE designed , general work DNAnexus within interactive R session. project way affiliated DNAnexus. fact, author particularly enjoy working platform, hence package. Main use-cases : Interact dx toolkit within R session, locally OFH TRE Jupyter session using convenience functions wrapping common calls dx Submit R commands worker job without need interact web interface DNAnexus relevant, functions work exclusively dependencies available OFH TRE JupyterLab workstation

title: Working with and on DNAnexus's Our Future Health Trusted Research Environment
text: dx_launch_workstation() dx_submit_r_job() Functions starting : dx_* dx_run_cmd() can used execute arbitrary dx commands slightly cleaner using system2() similar dx_upload can used upload result files worker project space option overwrite files name decode_single_select() decode_multi_select() decode_raw_ofh_file() Logging: simple_logger() due none available OFH find_tre_instance_type() don’t check rate card manually

title: Working with and on DNAnexus's Our Future Health Trusted Research Environment
text: package relies external python executable dx, using package Windows probably work within WSL. package work without issues Unix-based operating system.

title: Working with and on DNAnexus's Our Future Health Trusted Research Environment
text: external dependency package provides wrappers must installed separately. Package managers like uv conda can used purpose. location required binary can queried passed initialization function. activating environment, check path executable (requires whereis utility).
code: # Using conda conda create -n dxpy python=3.10 conda activate dxpy pip install dxpy  # Using uv uv venv uv pip install dxpy whereis dx

title: Working with and on DNAnexus's Our Future Health Trusted Research Environment
text: Locally, can install packacke using: OFH TRE, can upload package using Airlock system, since external packages can installed development must take place vanilla Jupyter Notebook environment. , convenience function provided (installing package locally) create single input string can written file submitted Airlock system. convenient auditing process. Locally, run following command create string containing functions. Write file upload TRE.
code: install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("comp-med/r-ofhelper") # `ofhelper_string` contains all functions of this package. Submit those to the airlock. ofhelper_string <- create_ofhelper_string() writeLines(ofhelper_string, "upload_this_via_the_airlock.txt")

title: Working with and on DNAnexus's Our Future Health Trusted Research Environment
text: Within R, can parse existing dx session, important first initialize dx_init() function. Afterwards, can check status package running get_dx_cache(). informs status available R session package’s functions (.e. package’s cache dx’s status). directly check status dx, run dx_get_env(), simply parses output dx env.
code: library("ofhelper")  # required if not in $PATH my_dx_binary <- "/PATH/TO/dx"   # required for initialization. Can be changed afterwards my_dx_project <- "project-12345"  # Required if not logged in already (outside of R) my_dx_access_token <- "..."  # Optional, will use `/` otherwise  my_dx_project_dir = <- "/some/dnanexus/directory/"  # Some Jupyter sessions do not provide internet access, so you can disable the # connectivity check here do_connectivity_check = TRUE  # set up the package using this function dx_init(   dx_binary = my_dx_binary,   dx_project = my_dx_project,   dx_token = my_dx_access_token,   dx_path = my_dx_project_dir,   check_connectivity = do_connectivity_check  ) get_dx_cache() #> [1] "/PATH/TO/dx" #>  #> $dx_project_id #> [1] "project-12345" #>  #> $dx_project_name #> [1] "YOUR_PROJECT_NAME" #>  #> $dx_path #> [1] "/some/dnanexus/directory/" #>  #> $dx_user #> [1] "your_user_name" #>  #> $dx_server_host #> [1] "api.dnanexus.com" #>  #> $dx_initialized #> [1] TRUE

title: Working with and on DNAnexus's Our Future Health Trusted Research Environment
text: launch workstation work interactively, use dx_launch_workstation(). can also get worker job URL using get_workstation_worker_url().
code: my_instance <- find_tre_instance_type(   required_n_cpus = 8,   required_gb_ram = 64,    required_gb_disk_storage = 256 ) my_worker_id <- dx_launch_workstation(   session_name = "my_workstation",    instance_type = my_instance )  # When the workstation is booted up, this will return the URL to use for interactive work get_workstation_worker_url(my_worker_id) #> https://...

title: Working with and on DNAnexus's Our Future Health Trusted Research Environment
text: submit R script local environment, can use dx_submit_r_job() function. simplifies required workflow paste code interactive session code changes slightly.
code: # Create script you'd want to execute on DNAnexus script_file <- tempfile(pattern = "r_job", fileext = ".R") writeLines("sessionInfo()", script_file)  # Submit the script - see the function documentation for the additional parameters dx_submit_r_job(   script_path = script_file,    include_ofhelper = F,    tag = "test" )

title: Working with and on DNAnexus's Our Future Health Trusted Research Environment
text: analysing SPARK database, data needs prepared analysis. steps include: Export (raw) data database Decode data (replace coded values meaning) applicable Clean explore coded data Transform data multiple items per participant variable Deriving new variables analysis & mapping terms existing ontologies exporting raw data decoding , functons export_entities() decode_raw_ofh_file() provided.

title: Working with and on DNAnexus's Our Future Health Trusted Research Environment
text: Dependencies functions can used restricted packages available OFH TRE. functions designed run local environment might include additional dependencies. data.table fs rlang glue

title: Working with and on DNAnexus's Our Future Health Trusted Research Environment
text: Look TODO tags functions! Tests mostly mock-tests right now Integration tests dx present yet Due straight forward nature package, function documentation generated using LLM, expect errors

title: Clean OFH Codings Table — clean_codings_table
text: Cleans standardizes OFH codings table handling NA representations standardizing meaning formats.

title: Clean OFH Codings Table — clean_codings_table
text: codings_table data.table containing codings information columns: coding_name, code, meaning, display_order, parent_code, entity

title: Clean OFH Codings Table — clean_codings_table
text: data.table cleaned codings table

title: Clean OFH Codings Table — clean_codings_table
text: function processes codings table : 1. Convert specific NA representations actual NA values 2. Standardize meaning formats extracting values "value = description" patterns 3. Ensures consistent data structure downstream decoding operations

title: Clean OFH Codings Table — clean_codings_table
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Clean a codings table # cleaned_table <- clean_codings_table(my_codings_table) } # }

title: Clean OFH Data Dictionary — clean_data_dictionary
text: Cleans standardizes OFH data dictionary table validating structure, fixing data types, ensuring consistent formatting.

title: Clean OFH Data Dictionary — clean_data_dictionary
text: data_dictionary data.table containing data dictionary information columns: entity, name, type, primary_key_type, coding_name, is_sparse_coding, is_multi_select, referenced_entity_field, relationship, folder_path, title, units, description, category, file, file_name, level, field_type, vcf_field, values

title: Clean OFH Data Dictionary — clean_data_dictionary
text: data.table cleaned data dictionary

title: Clean OFH Data Dictionary — clean_data_dictionary
text: function processes data dictionary : 1. Validate required column structure 2. Fix is_multi_select column use TRUE/FALSE instead TRUE/NA 3. Correct column type documentation (columns documented integer actually strings)

title: Clean OFH Data Dictionary — clean_data_dictionary
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Clean a data dictionary # cleaned_dict <- clean_data_dictionary(my_data_dictionary) } # }

title: Correct Data Column Type — correct_column_type
text: Corrects data column types decoding match annotated types.

title: Correct Data Column Type — correct_column_type
text: x Vector decoded data values annotated_type Character string specifying expected data type (one "string", "integer", "date", "float", "datetime", "numeric")

title: Correct Data Column Type — correct_column_type
text: Vector corrected data type

title: Correct Data Column Type — correct_column_type
text: internal function used convert decoded data appropriate data types based annotations data dictionary. called decoding operations ensure proper data types maintained downstream analysis.

what: Create Command Input String for Jupyter Workstation — create_cmd_input_string
title: Create Command Input String for Jupyter Workstation — create_cmd_input_string
text: Creates command input string submission Jupyter workstation using -icmd flag. Combines user script content ofhelper package code execution workstation environment.

title: Create Command Input String for Jupyter Workstation — create_cmd_input_string
Create Command Input String for Jupyter Workstation — create_cmd_input_string
text: file Character string specifying path user script file executed include_ofhelper Logical. TRUE (default), prepends complete ofhelper package source code user script content. FALSE, returns user script content.

title: Create Command Input String for Jupyter Workstation — create_cmd_input_string
text: Character string containing combined script content ready   submission Jupyter workstation via -icmd flag

title: Create Command Input String for Jupyter Workstation — create_cmd_input_string
text: function reads user script file optionally prepends complete ofhelper package source code ensure required functions available execution context. resulting string can passed Jupyter workstation using -icmd flag.

title: Create Command Input String for Jupyter Workstation — create_cmd_input_string
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create command string with ofhelper included # cmd_string <- create_cmd_input_string("my_analysis.R")  # Create command string without ofhelper (not recommended) # cmd_string <- create_cmd_input_string("my_analysis.R", include_ofhelper = FALSE) } # }

what: Create Complete ofhelper Package Source String — create_ofhelper_string
title: Create Complete ofhelper Package Source String — create_ofhelper_string
text: Creates complete concatenated string ofhelper package R script files. function specifically designed environments like Future Health TRE external packages installed, allowing complete package source embedded directly command executions.

title: Create Complete ofhelper Package Source String — create_ofhelper_string
Create Complete ofhelper Package Source String — create_ofhelper_string
text: Character string containing complete source code ofhelper   R scripts concatenated together

title: Create Complete ofhelper Package Source String — create_ofhelper_string
text: function reads R scripts ofhelper package combines single string can included command inputs, eliminating need package installation restricted environments.

title: Create Complete ofhelper Package Source String — create_ofhelper_string
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create the complete ofhelper package source # ofhelper_code <- create_ofhelper_string() } # }

title: Decode Multi-Select Variables — decode_multi_select
text: Decodes multi-select coded variables mapping coded values corresponding meanings within bracketed strings.

title: Decode Multi-Select Variables — decode_multi_select
text: x Character vector multi-select coded values. element format "[CODE1,CODE2]" "[CODE1|CODE2]" code Character vector coded values mapping meaning Character vector corresponding decoded meanings

title: Decode Multi-Select Variables — decode_multi_select
text: Character vector decoded values. Multi-select values maintain   bracketed format decoded meanings separated pipes.

title: Decode Multi-Select Variables — decode_multi_select
text: function processes multi-select data observation may contain multiple coded values separated commas pipes within brackets. replaces coded values decoded meanings preserving multi-select structure. separators normalized pipes downstream uniformity.

title: Decode Multi-Select Variables — decode_multi_select
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create mapping codes <- c("A1", "B2", "C3") meanings <- c("Option A", "Option B", "Option C")  # Decode multi-select variables # decoded <- decode_multi_select( #   x = c("[A1,B2]", "[C3]", "[A1|B2|C3]"), #   code = codes, #   meaning = meanings # ) # Result: c("[Option A|Option B]", "[Option C]", "[Option A|Option B|Option C]") } # }

title: Decode OFH Variable — decode_ofh_variable
text: Generic decoder function routes variable decoding either single-select multi-select decoding based is_multi_select parameter.

title: Decode OFH Variable — decode_ofh_variable
code: decode_ofh_variable(   variable,   is_multi_select = logical(),   code = character(),   meaning = character() )

title: Decode OFH Variable — decode_ofh_variable
text: variable vector coded values decoded is_multi_select Logical. TRUE, treats variable multi-select (multiple values per observation). FALSE, treats single-select (one value per observation). code Character vector coded values matched meaning Character vector corresponding decoded meanings

title: Decode OFH Variable — decode_ofh_variable
text: Character vector decoded values. multi-select variables,   returns character strings bracketed comma-separated values.   single-select variables, returns character vector decoded meanings.

title: Decode OFH Variable — decode_ofh_variable
text: function serves dispatcher calls appropriate decoding function (decode_single_select decode_multi_select) based whether variable represents single multiple selections.

title: Decode OFH Variable — decode_ofh_variable
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Decode a single-select variable # codes <- c("A1", "B2", "C3") # meanings <- c("Option A", "Option B", "Option C") # decoded <- decode_ofh_variable( #   variable = c("A1", "B2", "A1"), #   is_multi_select = FALSE, #   code = codes, #   meaning = meanings # )  # Decode a multi-select variable # decoded_multi <- decode_ofh_variable( #   variable = c("[A1,B2]", "[C3]"), #   is_multi_select = TRUE, #   code = codes, #   meaning = meanings # ) } # }

Regular expression pattern identify codings skipped (decoded). Columns matching pattern excluded decoding. verbose Logical. TRUE (default), prints progress messages decoding process.

text: data.table decoded data corrected data types. Returns   original raw data unchanged columns need decoding.

title: Initialize DNAnexus Environment — dx_init
text: dx_binary Character string specifying path dx binary. NULL (default), assumes "dx" PATH. dx_token Character string specifying DNAnexus authentication token. NULL (default), tries use existing authentication. dx_project Character string specifying DNAnexus project ID. Launch a DNAnexus Workstation Session — dx_launch_workstation
text: priority Character string specifying job priority. Must one "low", "normal", "high". Default "normal". session_name Character string specifying name workstation session. Default "jupyter_workstation". session_length_minutes Numeric specifying session duration minutes. Default 180 (3 hours). instance_type Character string specifying DNAnexus instance type. Must valid instance type TRE rate card. Default "azure:mem1_ssd2_v2_x2".

what: Submit R Script as DNAnexus Job — dx_submit_r_job
title: Submit R Script as DNAnexus Job — dx_submit_r_job
text: Submits custom R script job DNAnexus execution. function prepares executes R scripts DNAnexus environment using Jupyter workstation app.

title: Submit R Script as DNAnexus Job — dx_submit_r_job
code: dx_submit_r_job(   script_path,   instance_type = NULL,   priority = "normal",   session_name = NULL,   tag = NULL,   include_ofhelper = TRUE,   remote_inputs = NULL )

title: Submit R Script as DNAnexus Job — dx_submit_r_job
text: script_path Character string specifying path R script executed instance_type Character string specifying DNAnexus instance type. NULL (default), uses lowest instance rate card. priority Character string specifying job priority ("low", "normal", "high"). Default "normal". session_name Character string specifying job name. Default 'r_job_<timestamp>'. tag Character string tagging job. Default uses timestamp. include_ofhelper Logical. TRUE (default), includes complete ofhelper package source code ensure required functions available. remote_inputs Character vector DNAnexus file paths downloaded worker. Default NULL.

title: Submit R Script as DNAnexus Job — dx_submit_r_job
text: Job ID submitted DNAnexus job

title: Submit R Script as DNAnexus Job — dx_submit_r_job
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Submit an R script with default settings # job_id <- submit_r_job("path/to/my_script.R")  # Submit with custom parameters # job_id <- submit_r_job( #   script_path = "analysis.R", #   instance_type = "azure:mem2_ssd1_v2_x4", #   priority = "high", #   session_name = "my_analysis_job" # )  # Submit with remote input files # job_id <- submit_r_job( #   script_path = "analysis.R", #   remote_inputs = c("file-xxxxx", "file-yyyyy") # ) } # }

what: Explode Multi-Select Variables into Dummy Codes — explode_multi_select
title: Explode Multi-Select Variables into Dummy Codes — explode_multi_select
text: Converts multi-select variables (observation can contain multiple values separated commas pipes) dummy-coded variables. unique value becomes binary column indicating presence (TRUE) absence (FALSE) value.

title: Explode Multi-Select Variables into Dummy Codes — explode_multi_select
code: explode_multi_select(   x,   answer_separators = c(",", "|"),   long_format = FALSE,   na_is_none_of_the_above = TRUE )

title: Explode Multi-Select Variables into Dummy Codes — explode_multi_select
text: x Character vector containing multi-select data. element may contain multiple answers separated either commas (`,`) pipes (`|`). answer_separators Character vector specifying separators split answers. Default c(",", "|"). long_format Logical. TRUE, returns data long format three columns: index, original, variable (name dummy-coded variable) value (binary indicator). FALSE, returns wide format one column per unique value. na_is_none_of_the_above Logical. TRUE, treats "NA" values "none " (dummy variables FALSE). FALSE, treats "NA" values missing (dummy variables NA).

title: Explode Multi-Select Variables into Dummy Codes — explode_multi_select
text: data.table either:   - Wide format: one row per input element, one column per unique value (binary)   - Long format: three columns (index, original, variable, value)   - Additional columns: original (original input) index (row index)

title: Explode Multi-Select Variables into Dummy Codes — explode_multi_select
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Basic usage x <- c("A,B", "B,C", "A,C", "A|B|C") result <- explode_multi_select(x)  # With long format result_long <- explode_multi_select(x, long_format = TRUE)  # With custom separators x2 <- c("A;B", "B;C") result2 <- explode_multi_select(x2, answer_separators = ";") } # }

title: Export Entities from DNAnexus — export_entities
text: Submits table-exporter jobs export OFH data entities DNAnexus project. function exports multiple entities parallel using DNAnexus table-exporter app customizable parameters.

title: Export Entities from DNAnexus — export_entities
code: export_entities(   dataset_or_cohort_or_dashboard = NULL,   output_prefix = "ofh_raw_phenotype_data",   output_format = "CSV",   coding_option = "RAW",   header_style = "FIELD-NAME",   priority = "low",   instance_type = "azure:mem2_ssd1_v2_x4",   project_id = NULL,   work_dir = "/",   entities = NULL )

title: Export Entities from DNAnexus — export_entities
text: dataset_or_cohort_or_dashboard Character string specifying dataset, cohort, dashboard export data output_prefix Character string specifying prefix output files output_format Character string specifying output format (default "CSV") coding_option Character string specifying coding option (default "RAW") header_style Character string specifying header style (default "FIELD-NAME") priority Character string specifying job priority ("low", "normal", "high") (default "low") instance_type Character string specifying DNAnexus instance type (default "azure:mem2_ssd1_v2_x4") project_id Character string specifying DNAnexus project ID work_dir Character string specifying working directory DNAnexus, defaults project root entities Character vector entity names export. NULL (default), tries exports possible OFH entities - entities available result failed job.

title: Export Entities from DNAnexus — export_entities
text: NULL (side effect: submits DNAnexus jobs)

what: ofhelper: Working with and on DNAnexus's Our Future Health Trusted Research Environment — ofhelper-package
title: ofhelper: Working with and on DNAnexus's Our Future Health Trusted Research Environment — ofhelper-package
text: DNAnexus provides Trusted Research Environments (TREs) several large population-based cohort studies, like UK Biobank (UKB) Future Health (OFH). working TRE, provide `dx` Python utility interacting cloud environment. working within R, requires switching shell wrapping calls `system2()` similar. package provides several convenience wrappers . Additionally, enables submitting jobs arbitrary R codes local session. Finally, several default workflows OFH provided.

title: ofhelper: Working with and on DNAnexus's Our Future Health Trusted Research Environment — ofhelper-package
text: Maintainer: Carl Beuchel carl.beuchel@charite.de (ORCID)

what: Our Future Health TRE rate card — rate_card
title: Our Future Health TRE rate card — rate_card
text: rate card cloud computing instances used working DNAnexus cloud environment, specifically Future Health study, differs default instances.

title: Our Future Health TRE rate card — rate_card
Our Future Health TRE rate card — rate_card
text: ## `rate_card` data frame 48 rows 9 columns: dnanexus_instance_type Character string DNAnexus instance type identifier azure_instance_type Character string Azure VM instance type n_gpus Integer number GPUs n_cpus Integer number CPU cores ram_gb Integer RAM gigabytes disk_storage_gb Integer disk storage gigabytes storage_type Character string describing storage type on_demand_rate_gpb_per_h Numeric -demand rate GBP per hour spot_rate_gpb_per_h Numeric spot rate GBP per hour

title: Our Future Health TRE rate card — rate_card
text: <https://.storyblok.com/f/228028/x/bf1f0d1c41/our_future_health_trusted_research_environment_rate_card.pdf>

title: Get TRE Rate Card — tre_rate_card
text: Returns data table containing rate card information TRE (Research Environment) instance types. includes pricing, specifications, availability information various Azure virtual machine instances.

title: Get TRE Rate Card — tre_rate_card
text: data.table following columns: dnanexus_instance_type: DNAnexus instance type identifiers azure_instance_type: Corresponding Azure instance type names n_gpus: Number GPUs (always 0 TRE instances) n_cpus: Number CPU cores ram_gb: RAM gigabytes disk_storage_gb: Disk storage gigabytes storage_type: Storage type description on_demand_rate_gpb_per_h: -demand pricing per hour GBP spot_rate_gpb_per_h: Spot pricing per hour GBP

title: Get TRE Rate Card — tre_rate_card
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get the TRE rate card # rate_card <- tre_rate_card() # # View the rate card # head(rate_card) # # Find the cheapest instance type # cheapest <- rate_card[order(on_demand_rate_gpb_per_h)][1] } # }
